heading: wall street in a buying mood
subheading: stocks end higher, with across-the-board gains led by semiconductor and biotech shares.
author: wired staff
text: thursday was a largely up day on wall street for both blue chips and tech stocks, and for once, it wasn't just the same handful of technology issues rising, it was an across-the-board gain. the dow jones industrial average rose 47.25, or 0.42 percent to 11055.60, while the nasdaq composite index jumped 79.72, or 2.06 percent, to 3940.92.this came on almost no news announcements and no financial data from the federal government. josephthal & co. technology analyst bert hochfield admitted he was a little stumped. he described the day as a "barbell market," with stocks on both ends of the spectrum of value going up."perhaps people are really coming to grips with the fact that the economy is in good shape and it's not very likely that we'll see a recession, and on the other side that inflation is relatively tame," he said.hardwarelexmark (lxk) led the way in the hardware segment, up 4 1/8 to 55 1/8, while sun (sunw) jumped 4 1/16 to 119 7/16, thanks in part to hp's problems. apple computer (aapl) gained 2 15/16 to 51 7/16 and dell (dell) was up 11/16 to 39 1/8. hewlett-packard (hwp) was the big loser, down 3 5/8 to 108 after its stellar quarter numbers on wednesday got closer scrutiny, and one analyst with banc of america securities downgraded its stock. hp also announced a two-for-one stock split. va linux (lxun) lost 1 1/8 to 40 7/16 and palm (palm) slipped 3/16 to 33 9/16.softwareadobe systems (adbe) led the pack, up 8 15/16 to 124 7/8, while broadvision (bvsn) was up 5 1/2 to 33 1/2, oracle (orcl) gained 2 3/4 to 83 15/16, electronic arts (erts) rose 1 5/8 to 92 and microsoft (msft) gained 9/16 to 71 9/16. in the red was red hat (rhat), off 2 1/16 to 22 7/8 and intuit (intu) lost 3/16 to 47 7/16.semiconductorschip makers were still largely in the red, after four days of momentum. broadcom (brcm) led the way, up 7 3/16 to 247 1/2, amd (amd) jumped 2 3/4 to 68, rambus (rmbs) was right behind it, up 2 5/8 to 80 15/16, intel (intc) picked up 2 to 70 1/16 and motorola (mot) inched up 1/4 to 36 11/16. cypress semiconductor (cy) dropped 2 7/8 to 43 despite an upgrade by needham & co. to "strong buy." lsi logic (lsi) fell 1 3/8 to 39 1/8.consumer internetconsumer internet stocks were clobbered today, except for ebay (ebay), which soared 5 5/8 to 63 1/8 for no apparent reason, while priceline.com (pcln) inched up 3/16 to 25 5/16. expedia (expe) was flat at 15 7/8 while yahoo (yhoo) dropped 2 7/8 to 131 1/8, aol (aol) lost 7/16 to 55 1/16 and amazon (amzn) lost 3/8 to 38 1/4.telecommunicationstelco companies posted modest gains. nortel networks (nt) was up 13/16 to 81 13/16, ericsson (ericy) was up 11/16 to 20 1/16, mci worldcom (wcom) gained 3/8 to 35 1/4 and at&t (t) inched up 1/8 to 32 3/8. verizon (vz) continues to struggle, losing 1 3/8 to 40 3/8 and sprint (fon) fell 1 1/4 to 33.networkingstellar quarterly numbers and a bullish projection for the upcoming quarters propelled ciena (cien) up 16 to 179 1/4, while 3com (coms) gained 7/16 to 16 15/16, cisco (csco) rose 7/16 to 63 1/2 and lucent (lu) also gained 7/16, to 43 1/4. novell (novl) fell 15/16 to 10.
